ratings.comment: Dr. Pedriana clearly cares about his students. He let us go 5-7 minutes early from our power lectures consistently and the exams were all multiple choice based on mostly lecture content. He doesn't try to trick you and the readings are easy! Only one assignment a week other than exams.

Interesting and funny lectures, attendance is necessary to do well on exams. There are very few things in the gradebook, so exams are important to overall grade. There are 1-2 readings each week, but they're fairly short and interesting. I took this course as an easy ethnic studies requirement, but really enjoyed the content and learned a lot.

Nicholas is awesome and funny, great guy who obviously cares so much about his students and the class content. The class content is interesting, exams are hard but if you study and go to class you will be fine. All the TAs are also great and helpful. Barely any homework and the readings tend to be short and interesting.

Dr. Pedriana cares about his class and gives wide margins of error for the few homework assignments you have, mostly graded on discussion participation and lecture exams. Do all the readings and watch all the videos and you'll be fine. Make sure to pay attention to the graphs he puts in the lecture slides, those often appear on the tests.

You never know how he is going to be each day. Sometimes he goes on tangents and other days he reads straight off the slides. The homework is very easy; you just have to read. The readings are interesting though.

Very passionate guy with pretty interesting lectures despite being in a 75 minute class and usually lets us out a few minutes early. Grading is pretty clear and honestly if you just pay attention in class you should do pretty well on exams.
Engaging lecture, no more than an hour of textbook/article reading a week, easy weekly quizzes based on textbook readings.

Very interesing lectures. Only discussion was required for a grade. The exams were very easy and all multiple choice (no cumulative final). He is very clear about what topics will be on the exam so as long as you go to lecture (2/3) and do the readings (1/3 of the exam), you will get a great grade.

Really enjoy Pedriana and his class. I did not do as well as I would have liked but he could not make it clearer what was on each exam. If you show up to this class, you will do well. Plenty of opportunities to increase your grade, exams are not everything. Great guy, intriguing class!!

Great lecturer, interesting course content. Exams are all multiple choice and no cumulative final exam which is big. Makes it really clear what you need to know for exams. So long as you pay a little attention in class and skim the readings before exams, this course should be an easy A.

Soc 134 was my favorite class this semester! Prof Pedriana is an awesome professor who makes lectures interesting and seems passionate about what he's teaching about

Textbook is online and there are weekly readings that can take a long time. Stuff from lectures is also on exams. Read and go to lectures and you'll do great (minimal studying needed)
Such a sweet guy with so much to offer. Almost all test material was learned in lecture. Very interesting, informational, and passionate guy.
Love this man take his class

Loved prof Pedriana! Unfortunately he left early due to health issues and we had a guest lecturer for the rest of class but I definitely preferred the way he taught. Def good law school prep, it's very heavily focused on case law in a way most legal studies aren't. Loved him and would recommend to anyone! PS I had him for SOC 641 but can't find it.

He's a pretty good professor and a lot of the lecture material is on the exams. However, if you are taking this as a blow off class you can't really blow it off that much. You have to do the textbook readings which are long and study to get a decent grade. You need high 80s-90s to get an A in the class. Grade mostly based on exams.

Pedriana is the best soc professor out there. Extremely understanding of student circumstances. Does not go easy on grading, but he makes it easy to score well with passionate, and clearly structured lectures. Always stops and slows down when doubts arise, and always ensures that everyone is up to speed. Makes an effort to know names and chat!

Truly an amazing professor! Clearly cares about what he is teaching and creates a safe space to ask questions, even though it is a large lecture. As a junior who has taken dozens of courses, he is by far the best. I recommend you take this class.
